name: Chicago

authority.name: Chicago Department of Finance (Parking, Red Light & ASE)
authority.authority_name: City of Chicago Department of Finance
authority.serves_description: Processes most parking, red light and automated speed enforcement citations issued within the City of Chicago.

citation_pattern.notes: City of Chicago parking and camera citations display a 10-digit Notice Number, which must be used to contest or pay the citation【830560214250021†L190-L210】.

appeal_address.missing_reason: The official ‘Contest by Mail’ address could not be confirmed because the City of Chicago’s contest-by-mail webpage is restricted; a mailing address must be verified by calling the ticket help line.

method_constraints: Initial Review request must be submitted within 21 days of issuance or 14 days from first notice
submission_methods.notes: The City of Chicago allows contesting a citation by mail, through the e-hearing system, via telephone or in person; mailing address must be confirmed due to restricted access to contest-by-mail page.

phone_confirmation.department: City of Chicago Ticket Help Line
phone_confirmation.purpose: Confirm the correct mailing address for submitting an Initial Review (phase‑1) of a parking citation.

verification.source_note: City of Chicago eHearing and payment plan FAQs provide the 10-digit Notice Number requirement but do not list a mailing address; the contest-by-mail page is restricted, so the mailing address must be confirmed by phone.

official_confirmation_department: City of Chicago Ticket Help Line
official_confirmation_purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing for Chicago parking citations.
qa_blocking_issues: City of Chicago contest-by-mail address remains unverified due to restricted website access.
Routing of Chicago Police Department citations to the Department of Finance requires confirmation.
qa_known_gaps: Missing mailing addresses for University of Chicago, Loyola University Chicago, Northwestern University, and Illinois Institute of Technology due to online-only appeal procedures.
Potential additional issuing authorities (such as Chicago airports or park districts) were not identified because of limited publicly available information.
